content.content:
Azure Arc - Deployment Progress
This dashboard tracks the progress of the Azure Arc deployment.

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
// Count of all Servers
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines'
| summarize ServerCount = count()

partHeader.title: Servers
partHeader.subtitle: Count of servers enabled by Azure Arc

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.title: Physical Core Count
partHeader.subtitle: Count of all cores on all servers enabled by Azure Arc

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
resources 
//Arc registered VMs (Windows & linux)
| where type == "microsoft.hybridcompute/machines"
| extend provisioningState = tostring(properties.provisioningState)
| extend status = tostring((properties.status))
| extend machineName = name
| extend machineId = tolower(tostring(id))
| where provisioningState == "Succeeded"
| summarize provisionedServers = count()

partHeader.title: Provisioned Servers
partHeader.subtitle: Servers where Provisioning State = "Succeeded"

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
resources 
//Arc registered VMs (Windows & linux)
| where type == "microsoft.hybridcompute/machines"
| extend provisioningState = tostring(properties.provisioningState)
| extend status = tostring((properties.status))
| extend machineName = name
| extend machineId = tolower(tostring(id))
| where status == "Connected"
| summarize connectedServers = count()

partHeader.title: Connected Servers
partHeader.subtitle: Servers where Status is "Success"

content.content:
Connected and Provisioned Servers Fully connected Arc enabled servers have a positive connection & provisioning status. Total connected & provisioned servers should ideally equal total servers.
.

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.title: Windows Servers
partHeader.subtitle: Count of Windws Servers registered to Arc

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.title: Windows Servers Core Count
partHeader.subtitle: Count of Windws Servers Cores registered to Arc

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
resources
//Arc registered VMs (Windows & linux)
| where type == "microsoft.hybridcompute/machines"
//Status
| extend provisioningState = tostring(properties.provisioningState)
| extend status = tostring((properties.status))
//Operating System
| extend osSku = tostring(properties.osSku)
| extend osName = tostring(properties.osName)
| extend osVersion = tostring(properties.osVersion)
//Windows or Linux
| extend osType = tostring(properties.osType)
| where osType == "windows"
| where provisioningState == "Succeeded"
| summarize windowsServerProvisioned = count()

partHeader.title: Provisioned Windows Server Servers
partHeader.subtitle: Windows Server servers where Provisioning State = "Succeded"

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
resources
//Arc registered VMs (Windows & linux)
| where type == "microsoft.hybridcompute/machines"
//Status
| extend provisioningState = tostring(properties.provisioningState)
| extend status = tostring((properties.status))
//Operating System
| extend osSku = tostring(properties.osSku)
| extend osName = tostring(properties.osName)
| extend osVersion = tostring(properties.osVersion)
//Windows or Linux
| extend osType = tostring(properties.osType)
| where osType == "windows"
| where status == "Connected"
| summarize windowsServerProvisioned = count()

partHeader.title: Connected Windows Server Servers
partHeader.subtitle: WIndows Server servers which have a "connected" status

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
resources
//Arc registered VMs (Windows & linux)
| where type == "microsoft.hybridcompute/machines"
//Boolean - SQL installed (true/false)
| extend mssqlDiscovered = properties.mssqlDiscovered
| where mssqlDiscovered == 'true'
| summarize ServerCount = count()

partHeader.title: Servers with SQL Server Discovered
partHeader.subtitle: Count of Servers where SQL Server has been discovered

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.title: Servers with SQL Server extension installed
partHeader.subtitle: Count of servers with SQL Server extension Installed

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.title: Servers with at Least One SQL Server Engine Instance
partHeader.subtitle: Servers with SQL Server discovered and at least 1 instance of SQL Server installed

content.content:
SQL Instance Metrics 3 requirements for completed SQL Server Instance registration
  1. SQL Server discovered on Server
  2. SQL Server extension installed correctly
  3. At least 1 SQL Server engine instance created
These 3 metrics will be equal if all SQL Servers have been registered correctly unless some servers have SQL Server installed but not the SQL Server engine role. Some servers may have only some of the other roles like Analysis Services, Reporting Services, or Integration Services.

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
resources
| where type == 'microsoft.azurearcdata/sqlserverinstances'
| summarize SQLInstanceCount = count()

partHeader.title: SQL Server Instances
partHeader.subtitle: Servers can host multiple SQL Server instances

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.title: Servers with SQL Server Ent/Std Edition
partHeader.subtitle: Servers with at least one instance of Standard or Enterprisre Edition

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.title: Total SQL Server servers with "Paid" License Type
partHeader.subtitle: Count of all SQL Server servers with Ent/Std Edition and "Paid" license type

content.content: SQL License Type Tracks the setting of the SQL Server License Type

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
resources
| where  type == "microsoft.azurearcdata/sqlserverinstances/databases"
| summarize countDBs = count()

partHeader.title: Total SQL Server Databases
partHeader.subtitle: Count of all databases across all instances

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
resources
| where type == 'microsoft.azurearcdata/sqlserverinstances'
| extend provisioningState = tostring(properties.provisioningState)
| extend status = tostring(properties.status)
| where provisioningState == "Succeeded"
| summarize succeedededProvisioningInstanceCount = count()

partHeader.title: Provisioned SQL Server Instasnces
partHeader.subtitle: Count of SQL Server instances provisioned

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
resources
| where type == 'microsoft.azurearcdata/sqlserverinstances'
| extend provisioningState = tostring(properties.provisioningState)
| extend status = tostring(properties.status)
| where status == "Connected"
| summarize connectedInstanceCount = count()

partHeader.title: Connected SQL Server Instances
partHeader.subtitle: Count of Instances connected fully to Arc

content.content: Connected and Provisioned Instances Windows & Linux VMs can host multiple SQL Server Instances and so the total number of SQL Server Instances can exceed the number of SQL Server servers (servers with SQL Server discovered). Some servers may have SQL Sewrver discovered but there are no SQL Server engine instances and only other SQL Server roles such as Analysis Services, Reporting Services, or Integration Services are installed. Total Connected & Provisioned instances should ideally equal Total SQL Server instances

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.title: SQL Server Extension -> DPS Upload Status
partHeader.subtitle: Extension -> DPS Upload Status indicates if a server is not fully connected. OK is the desired status.

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.title: Windows Server Status
partHeader.subtitle: WIndows Server by status

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
// Arc Queries - All Windows Servers by Subscription, Resource Group, Type
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines'
| extend CoreCount = toint (properties.detectedProperties.logicalCoreCount)
| extend OSVersion = tostring(properties.osSku)
| extend ESUAttached = iff(properties.licenseProfile.esuProfile.esuKeyState =="Inactive", 0, 1)
| join kind=inner (
    resourcecontainers
    | where type == 'microsoft.resources/subscriptions'
    | project subscriptionId, subscriptionName = name)
    on subscriptionId
| project subscriptionName, resourceGroup, OSVersion, ESUAttached, CoreCount
| summarize ServerCount = count()  by subscriptionName
| order by subscriptionName

partHeader.title: Servers enabled by Subscription
partHeader.subtitle: Servers enabled by Azure Arc by subscription

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
// Arc Queries - All Windows Servers by Location
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines'
| extend CoreCount = toint (properties.detectedProperties.logicalCoreCount)
| extend OSVersion = tostring(properties.osSku)
| extend ESUAttached = iff(properties.licenseProfile.esuProfile.esuKeyState =="Inactive", 0, 1)
| extend location = tostring(tags.Location)
| join kind=inner (
    resourcecontainers
    | where type == 'microsoft.resources/subscriptions'
    | project subscriptionId, subscriptionName = name)
    on subscriptionId
| project subscriptionName, resourceGroup, OSVersion, ESUAttached, CoreCount, location
| summarize ServerCount = count() by location
| order by location

partHeader.title: Servers by "Location" tag
partHeader.subtitle: Servers enabled by Azure Arc by "Location" tag

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
//Servers by OS Version
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines'
| extend OSVersion = tostring(properties.osSku)
| project OSVersion
| summarize ServerCount = count() by OSVersion
| order by ServerCount desc

partHeader.title: Servers by OS
partHeader.subtitle: Servers enabled by Azure Arc by OS version

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
// Arc Queries - All Windows Servers by Subscription, Resource Group, Type
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines'
| extend CoreCount = toint (properties.detectedProperties.logicalCoreCount)
| extend OSVersion = tostring(properties.osSku)
| extend ESUAttached = iff(properties.licenseProfile.esuProfile.esuKeyState =="Inactive", 0, 1)
| join kind=inner (
    resourcecontainers
    | where type == 'microsoft.resources/subscriptions'
    | project subscriptionId, subscriptionName = name)
    on subscriptionId
| project subscriptionName, resourceGroup, OSVersion, ESUAttached, CoreCount
| summarize ServerCount = count()  by subscriptionName, resourceGroup, OSVersion

partHeader.title: Servers - Summary
partHeader.subtitle: All servers by subscription, resource group, and OS version

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
// Run query to see results.
resources
| where type == "microsoft.azurearcdata/sqlserverinstances"
//| wheretype== "microsoft.hybridcompute/machines"
//| whereproperties.detectedProperties.mssqldiscovered== "true"
| extend d=parse_json(properties)
| extend Patch=d["patchLevel"]
| extend SQLVersion=tostring(d["version"])
| extend  Edition=d["edition"]
| extend License=d["licenseType"]
| project name, Patch, SQLVersion, Edition, License
| summarize SQLServerVersionCount=count() by SQLVersion
| order by SQLServerVersionCount desc

partHeader.title: SQL Server Instances by Version
partHeader.subtitle: SQL Server instasnces enabled by Azure Arc by SQL Server version

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.title: SQL Server License Type for Enterprise & Standard
partHeader.subtitle: SQL Server server license type across all servers hosting Ent & Std Edition SQL Server instances

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.title: SQL Server License Type Settings by Subscription, Resource Group for Enterprise & Standard
partHeader.subtitle: SQL Server License Type settings for "production" SQL Server servers

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
// Arc Queries - All Windows Servers by Subscription, Resource Group, Type
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines'
| extend CoreCount = toint (properties.detectedProperties.logicalCoreCount)
| extend OSVersion = tostring(properties.osSku)
| extend ESUAttached = iff(properties.licenseProfile.esuProfile.esuKeyState =="Inactive", 0, 1)
| join kind=inner (
    resourcecontainers
    | where type == 'microsoft.resources/subscriptions'
    | project subscriptionId, subscriptionName = name)
    on subscriptionId
| project subscriptionName, resourceGroup, OSVersion, ESUAttached, CoreCount
| summarize ServerCount = count() , TotalCores = sum(CoreCount), TotalESU =sum(ESUAttached) by subscriptionName, resourceGroup, OSVersion

partHeader.title: Servers - Summary
partHeader.subtitle: All servers by subscription, resource group, OS version

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
// Run query to see results.
resources
| where type == "microsoft.azurearcdata/sqlserverinstances"
| extend d=parse_json(properties)
| extend Patch=d["patchLevel"]
| extend SQLVersion=d["version"]
| extend  Edition=d["edition"]
| extend License=d["licenseType"]
| join kind=inner (
    resourcecontainers
    | where type == 'microsoft.resources/subscriptions'
    | project subscriptionId, subscriptionName = name)
    on subscriptionId
| project subscriptionName, resourceGroup, Patch, SQLVersion, Edition, License
| summarize ServerCount=count() by subscriptionName, resourceGroup, tostring(SQLVersion)

partHeader.subtitle: All SQL Server instances by subscription, resource group, version
